bioshift.core.spectrumreference moduleÂ¶

class bioshift.core.spectrumreference.SpectrumReference(spectrum_shape: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], spectral_width: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], spectrometer_frequency: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], ref_coord: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]], ref_ppm: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]])Â¶

Bases: object

Contains the referencing information required to create the spectrum transform.

spectrum_shapeÂ¶

Number of data points along each axis of the spectrum.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, â€¦], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

Width of the spectrum along each axis in Hz.

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, â€¦], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

ref_coord: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]Â¶
ref_ppm: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]Â¶

spectrometer_frequency: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]Â¶
spectrum_shape: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]Â¶
transform() → SpectrumTransformÂ¶

Transform object derived from the referencing information. Uses linear relationship between spectrum coordinates and chemical shifts to determine the scaling and offset of the transformation.

Returns:

SpectrumTransform object corresponding to provided spectrum referencing.

bioshift.core.spectrumtransform moduleÂ¶

class bioshift.core.spectrumtransform.SpectrumTransform(scaling, offset)Â¶

Bases: object

Represents a diagonal affine transformation used to map between coordinates in the raw spectrum array and chemical shift values.

scalingÂ¶

Vector of scaling factors for each axis.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, â€¦], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

offsetÂ¶

Offset vector.

Type:

numpy.ndarray[tuple[Any, â€¦], numpy.dtype[numpy._typing._array_like._ScalarT]]

Properties:

inverse: The inverse of the transform.

apply(point: ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]) → ndarray[tuple[Any, ...], dtype[_ScalarT]]Â¶

Apply the transformation to a point.

Returns:

Transformed point as a vector.

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If the shapes of the input point and the transform do not match.
